body:
l2geth config i used.

CHAIN_ID=69
DATADIR=/geth
DEV=true
NETWORK_ID=69
NO_DISCOVER=true
NO_USB=true
GASPRICE=0
GCMODE=archive
IPC_DISABLE=true
ETH1_CTC_DEPLOYMENT_HEIGHT=25502591
ETH1_L1_CROSS_DOMAIN_MESSENGER_ADDRESS=0x4361d0F75A0186C05f971c566dC6bEa5957483fD
ETH1_L1_STANDARD_BRIDGE_ADDRESS=0x22F24361D548e5FaAfb36d1437839f080363982B
ETH1_SYNC_SERVICE_ENABLE=true
ROLLUP_ADDRESS_MANAGER_OWNER_ADDRESS=0x18394b52d3cb931dfa76f63251919d051953413d
ETH1_L1_FEE_WALLET_ADDRESS=0x18394B52d3Cb931dfA76F63251919D051953413d
ROLLUP_BACKEND=l2
ROLLUP_CLIENT_HTTP=http://dtl:7878
ROLLUP_DISABLE_TRANSFERS=false
ROLLUP_ENABLE_L2_GAS_POLLING=false
ROLLUP_GAS_PRICE_ORACLE_OWNER_ADDRESS=0x18394B52d3Cb931dfA76F63251919D051953413d
ROLLUP_STATE_DUMP_PATH=https://storage.googleapis.com/optimism/kovan/v0.4.0-rc0.json
ROLLUP_MAX_CALLDATA_SIZE=40000
ROLLUP_POLL_INTERVAL_FLAG=3s
ROLLUP_SYNC_SERVICE_ENABLE=true
ROLLUP_TIMESTAMP_REFRESH=3m
ROLLUP_VERIFIER_ENABLE=true
RPC_ADDR=0.0.0.0
RPC_API=eth,rollup,net,web3,debug
RPC_CORS_DOMAIN=*
RPC_ENABLE=true
RPC_PORT=8545
RPC_VHOSTS=*
TARGET_GAS_LIMIT=11000000
USING_OVM=true
WS_ADDR=0.0.0.0
WS_API=eth,rollup,net,web3,debug
WS_ORIGINS=*
WS=true
VERBOSITY=10
I am running the l2geth in docker. It could be accidentally killed for OOM error. Could be related to this?

I have two comments so that Optimism's dev team has an easier time trying to get to the source of your issue:

> **To Reproduce**
> Running Verifier which connects to Kovan Sequencer.

Could you provide more detailed steps in your repro case?
We want to know the exact steps that you took to produce this error.

> Console log:

Since these logs are long, it would really help readers if the logs were put into a code block 🙂.

> l2geth config i used.

Put your l2geth config in a code block as well 😃

I'm getting similar behavior on replicas that OOM.

Chatting with Mark it looks like the block it tries to pull in on startup is the same block that it previously ingested?

This release fixes the memory leak which should greatly reduce the probability of you experiencing this issue in the future.
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/releases/tag/%40eth-optimism%2Fl2geth%400.4.8

The problem happens when there is an unclean shutdown, the database can become corrupted. I believe calling `debug.setHead(tip.blockNumber - 1)` and then restarting should fix the problem

I'm quite confident that we've fixed the memory leak as described in the comment by @tynes above. I'm going to close this issue. If you're still experiencing the same issue I will be happy to reopen this issue.
